title: problem with custome video player
content:
Hi, when I launch a custom video player on a certain site and go into full screen mode, and then want to exit it through ESC, I can’t do it and the picture freezes. I went to the browser console, and it gave me this error: Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Not in fullscreen mode 

   cancelFullScreen https://interneturok.ru/assets/custom-2dc6965f3c367b4e4590249bd2036dfc.js:578    hotkeys https://interneturok.ru/assets/custom-2dc6965f3c367b4e4590249bd2036dfc.js:675    dispatcher https://interneturok.ru/assets/custom-2dc6965f3c367b4e4590249bd2036dfc.js:131|

The technical support of that site told me to write to the browser support, I understood the problem is not on their side. I tried everything and went through incognito mode, the problem did not go away. Give me some advice or maybe the problem is with this site and not with the browser, I also tried to launch this video player through Google Chrome and there were no problems there

title: Why is Instagram not loading properly on Firefox? Any fixes?
content:
I've been having issues with Instagram not loading properly on Firefox. Sometimes images and videos don’t appear, and the site feels slow compared to Chrome. This makes it frustrating, especially when trying to engage with my audience and grow my Instagram followers.

I’ve tried clearing my cache, disabling extensions, and even updating my browser, but nothing seems to work. Is this a common issue with Firefox, or is there a specific setting I need to change?

As, I run a business, where people can buy Instagram followers to give their profiles a boost. People often ask questions about services on Instagram DMs. So, having Instagram work smoothly on all browsers is important.

Has anyone else faced this problem? Any fixes that worked for you?"

title: Antivirové hlášení v hlavičce emailu
content:
Dobrý den, vždy po přijetí emailu a následném pokusu o vytisknutí mi jednu celou stránku (ne vždy, někdy je tam i něco co potřebuju vytisknout, proto nemůžu tisknout od druhé stránky) zabere něco jako antivirové hlášení: 1. X-Mozilla Status X-Mozilla Status2 X-Virus-Scanned X-Spam-Flag X-Spam-Score X-Spam-Status Received Autentication-Result DKIM-Signature Received Content-Type Content-Transfer-Encoding Verze MIME ID zprávy X-Mailer

V emailu je to v hlavičce emailu, tedy pod adresou ze které email přišel: Adresa- Datum- Antivirové hlášení- Až poté text samotného emailu.

Jak to prosím dostat pryč, abych mohl emaily tisknout bez problému a neplýtval barvou tiskárny?

title: Credit card data stopped being populated
content: Hi. Populating stored credit card data used to be working fine, but has stopped working on my desktop PC several moths ago (at least). When I click on one of the stored credit cards on a payment page, nothing gets populated in the fields. That happens with all stored cards. On my laptop PC that has a fingerprint sensor the populating of credit card data still works, but now I'm being asked for a fingerprint. Before I didn't need to provide my fingerprint to use the stored credit card data. I assume by the different behaviors of the desktop and laptop machines that at some point some "security feature" has been added to Firefox that broke usage of the stored credit card data on my desktop PC. What is that and how can I disable it?

title: FF not opening after using Ccleaner
content:
Hi, In the last hour FF has stopped working completely. I made the mistake of using Ccleaner, which is probably the problem, I haven't had issues cleaning before, though I usually check the registry before deleting and don't recall seeing any entry for Mozilla (I may be wrong, though).

Firefox was working fine a couple of hours ago, but now it won't open at all, except in admin mode and then it won't open any links or tabs, not even settings. I've uninstalled FF, deleted the folder in the Programs folder, and reinstalled it from scratch, but there is no change (the one difference is that it wouldn't open in Admin after before I reinstalled it). Waterfox doesn't open either, but Thunderbird seems to work with no problems.

Thanks, Matt

title: Why has my firefox browser gone Nazi?
content:
Firefox is putting me in indefinite timeouts. WTH?!

It has suddenly decided to create a two hour timeout, which is now going on 24 hours and counting.

"The sign-in option is disabled because of failed sign-in attempts or repeated shutdowns. Use a different sign-in option, or keep your device powered on for at least two hours and then try again."

It is not my browser's job to police me. How do I get rid of this obnoxious crap forever? I Lart of the issue is the NumLock is no longer automatically activated. It always was before.

I also don't care for it's challenge question where I have to enter in A1B2C3. I have a security protocol and don't need more to bog me down!
creator: LoisLaine

title: Discord mic not working
content:
I blocked it for a quick second. I had no idea it would be a multi hour nightmare to get it back on, and it still isn't. Why? Well because the "help link" page no longer exits, ratherthe page that the image that it shows no longer exists. You don't have the option to turn it back on, and why in the hell would I have to go to firefox settings to turn it back on to begin with.

I literally just now figured it out. Holy fuck. For me anyway.

Go into discord settings and click on the voice & video and hit "let's check". Click yes when it asks to allow permission.

I'm just so damn glad someone got butthurt earlier and erased my post. You're fucking trash for doing that.

Hopefully this is actually helpful to folks having problems. I'm not a butthurt little bitch like the folks that look over this site. I actually help.
creator: Charles3rddd

title: Firefox crash multiple times during video playback (Once/Twice not caused by video)
content:
Firefox crashes randomly during video playback. I've submitted over 10 crash reports. Here's the two latest crash report (which includes my device's hardware information): https://crash-stats.mozilla.org/report/index/81eb1750-1dd0-490d-9eb1-d3c2c0250224 https://crash-stats.mozilla.org/report/index/6682a7f2-836a-4365-938e-c9ab20250224

I'm on Fedora 41 + gnome, but this issue persisted even in Windows 11, which caused BSOD therefore I made the switch to linux (At least in linux it doesn't crash the whole system, only firefox). If you need any additional information let me know. I can run journalctl/dmesg if required.

I've already tried things like restarting in safe mode (troubleshoot mode), refreshing firefox etc. Didn't work.

Thanks in advance!
creator: dennisheyuxi
